qas.question: Who was Philip Arrhidaues' half brother?
Who was the leading calvary commander?
Who order the death of Meleager?
What city was partitioned to the generals who supported Perdiccas?
Who documented that Perdiccas' was under suspicion?

context: Meleager and the infantry supported the candidacy of <a0_0>Alexander<a0_0/>'s half-brother, Philip Arrhidaeus, while <a1_0>Perdiccas<a1_0/>, the leading cavalry commander, supported waiting until the birth of Alexander's unborn child by Roxana. After the infantry stormed the palace of Babylon, a compromise was arranged – Arrhidaeus (as Philip III) should become king, and should rule jointly with Roxana's child, assuming that it was a boy (as it was, becoming Alexander IV). Perdiccas himself would become regent (epimeletes) of the empire, and Meleager his lieutenant. Soon, however, <a2_0>Perdiccas<a2_0/> had Meleager and the other infantry leaders murdered, and assumed full control. The generals who had supported Perdiccas were rewarded in the partition of <a3_0>Babylon<a3_0/> by becoming satraps of the various parts of the empire, but Perdiccas' position was shaky, because, as <a4_0>Arrian<a4_0/> writes, "everyone was suspicious of him, and he of them".
